abstract: At Arizona State University, undergraduate teacher candidates were asked to make biweekly journal entries relating course content to beliefs and knowledge about teaching, classroom applications, children's probable responses, and personal reflections about teaching and learning. Many students organized their entries according to a reaction-elaboration-contemplation sequence. Includes three references. (MLH)
meta: January 1991Educational leadership: journal of the Department of Supervision and Curriculum Development, N.E.A 48(6)
